tool_description: Models air pollutant dispersion and concentration levels from mining operations using meteorological data and emission sources.

emission_sources.description: List of emission sources (trucks, crushers, conveyers, blasting, etc.)

particulate_rate.description: Particulate matter emission rate in kg/hour

atmospheric_stability.description: Atmospheric stability class (A, B, C, D, E, F)

error_messages: Invalid emission rates: Emission rates must be non-negative numbers.
Invalid meteorological parameters: Wind speed must be > 0, wind direction 0-360, temperature > -50.
Invalid atmospheric stability: Use classes A, B, C, D, E, or F.
Invalid stack height: Stack height must be positive.
Invalid modeling distance: Modeling distance must be between 1-50 km.
usage: Provide emission sources, rates, and meteorological conditions to model air pollutant dispersion patterns and ground-level concentrations.

max_pm10_concentration.description: Maximum predicted PM10 concentration in µg/m³

max_pm25_concentration.description: Maximum predicted PM2.5 concentration in µg/m³

max_so2_concentration.description: Maximum predicted SO2 concentration in µg/m³

max_nox_concentration.description: Maximum predicted NOx concentration in µg/m³

impact_zone_radius.description: Radius of significant impact zone in kilometers

exceedance_areas.description: Areas where concentrations exceed regulatory limits

modeling_summary.description: Summary of air quality modeling results
